title: Multirepresentation and Microlearning-Based Calculus Education Design

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic functions and algebraic operations
context.additional_context: Learners explore core calculus concepts through blended online and in-person instruction, focusing on applied problem-solving linked to everyday scenarios

learning_goals: Learners can analyze and explain function limits and differentiability using multiple representations (graphs, tables, algebraic expressions, verbal descriptions)
Learners can explain how to apply derivative concepts appropriately in context through 5-minute microlearning modules
Learners can convert real-life problems (e.g., distance calculation, optimization) into mathematical models and apply differentiation to propose solutions
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
